page.description: Executes code on change of some aspect of a path changes (flags F= files renamed/add/delete D= sub-directory renamed/added/deleted A=Attributes changed L=Length of file(s) changed T=Time Changed S=File security changed R=recurse).
page.prototype: V FILE.Watch_create(C Watchname , C Path , C flags , C Code)

argument.name: Watchname
argument.description: An arbitrary name assigned to the watch. You use this name in the FILE.WATCH_DESTROY().

argument.name: Path
argument.description: The folder that you want to monitor.

argument.name: flags
argument.description: Flags - the flags that indicate which events you want to trap. The flags are:

item.name: T
item.description: Date/time stamp on a file changed.

argument.name: Code
argument.description: A string containing the Xbasic code to be executed. E.g. " script_play(\"script_to_run\") ".

page.discussion: The FILE.WATCH_CREATE() method allows you to monitor the activity in a particular folder on your computer, and automatically execute Xbasic code when:

item.name: a file is added or deleted in the folder
the size of a file in the folder is changed
the attributes of a file in the folder are changed
the date/time stamp on a file changed
security settings on a file in the folder are changed

section.description: You can specify which of the events to react to.

section.title: Example
section.example: FILE.watch_create("temp_dir", "c:\temp", "F", "my_alert_function()") ? FILE.watch_enumerate() = temp_dir c:\temp F FILE.watch_destroy("temp_dir")
